See also: eür

English[edit]

Adverb[edit]

euer

  1. obsolete typography of ever

Anagrams[edit]

  • Eure

German[edit]

Alternative forms[edit]

  • ewer (obsolete)
  • eurer (for the pronoun, proscribed)

Etymology[edit]

From Old High German iuwar, from Proto-Germanic *izweraz. Compare English your, Dutch jouw.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈɔʏ̯ɐ/
  • audio
    		(file)
  • Rhymes: -ɔɪ̯ɐ

Pronoun[edit]

euer

  1. (personal) genitive singular of ihr.
    Die Macht ist euer!
    The power is yours.
    • Leonid Andrejew, Otto Buek, Judas Ischariot und die andern, page 82:
      Höre! Euer sind hier viele.

Usage notes[edit]

See usage notes on ihr.

Determiner[edit]

euer

  1. your (addressing two or more people informally)
    Eure Zeit ist um.
    Your time is up.

Related terms[edit]

  • Ew.
  • euresgleichen, euersgleichen
